comments.author: angela
comments.body:
List of missing test-cases (incomplete to be updated):
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- tests for same-named Node and Property below a given Node.
  this was forbidden with JCR 1.0 and is now a mandatory feature (according to the latest info available)
  test should be created for
  - addNode
  - setProperty
  - move
  - copy
  - ...

- test for the correct version being displayed in the jcr-version descriptor

- Node.getIdentifier

- Node.setPrimaryType

- NodeTypeManager.hasNodeType(String)

- Illegal characters in JCR Name (and thus Path). Set of illegal characters has changed since JCR 1.0

comments.author: Manfred Baedke
comments.body: modified versioning tests to cover jcr2.0 api (incomplete).

comments.author: Julian Reschke
comments.body: API coverage as of May 22 (82%); mainly node type management, new property types and advanced versioning missing.

comments.author: Manfred Baedke
comments.body: Tests for the JCR-2.0 binary value object.

comments.author: Julian Reschke
comments.body: Binary tests added with revision 779583; thanks Manfred.

comments.author: Stefan Guggisberg
comments.body: javax.jcr.Repository is not included in the API coverage report

comments.author: Julian Reschke
comments.body: This was caused by a syntax error in the exclude file, which attempted to exclude two variants of the login method but in the end excluded the whole class (note this problem was already present in the 1.0 TCK).

comments.author: Jukka Zitting
comments.body:
Looks promising! The only methods with no TCK tests touching them are:

    VersionManager.merge(String, String, boolean, boolean)
    VersionManager.merge(Node)

comments.author: Tobias Bocanegra
comments.body: i will take care of those.

comments.author: Tobias Bocanegra
comments.body:
added test cases that cover the 2 signatures mentioned above:
- MergeActivityTest
- MergeShallowTest

comments.author: Julian Reschke
comments.body: API coverage as of Aug 06: 522/522. Hurray!

comments.author: Julian Reschke
comments.body: The test suite has reached 100% API coverage for JCR 2.0, therefore closing the issue.

description: Umbrella issue for changes/additions to JUnit test cases, setup and config.
